newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazilian real drops 0.06 pct in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: Brazilian real drops 0.06 pct in quiet trading.

text.p: Brazil's real dropped 0.06 percent in calm trading to close at 1.0731 per dollar on the commercial foreign exchange market on expectations of an upcoming decline in the real-dollar mini-band, dealers said.
The current mini-band was set by the Central Bank on Monday at between 1.0720 and 1.0770 reais per dollar and players are expecting a 0.1 percent decline in coming days.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0776 per greenback, down 0.01 percent.
In the parallel market, the real ended steady at 1.125 per dollar, traders said.
